title: Vista Resource Kit 2 nd Edition Cd with eBook (mAnaV)
description:
Windows Vista Resource Kit CD with Ebook 2nd Edition

==================
WHAT'S ON THIS CD?
==================

This companion CD contains:

- Windows Vista Resource Kit eBook
- Scripts, Tools, and Resources
- Additional Reading
- Tools for Reading
- Additional Resources

--------------------------------
Windows Vista Resource Kit eBook
--------------------------------
The complete text of the print book is contained on this CD in a
searchable PDF eBook. To view this eBook, open the PDF file in the
eBook folder.
 
Note: The eBook is in Portable Document Format (PDF). To view this
file, you will need Adobe Acrobat or Adobe Reader. For more
information about these products or to download Adobe Reader,
visit the Adobe Web site at http://www.adobe.com. 

-----------------------------
Scripts, Tools, and Resources
-----------------------------
In the Scripts, Tools, Resources folder are sample administration 
scripts written in VBScript and Windows PowerShell, various other 
tools and resources, and links to where you can find additional 
Microsoft technical documentation about Windows Vista.  

The files in the Scripts, Tools, Resources folder are organized by 
chapter, with the addition of an All VBScript Scripts folder that 
contains a single .zip file of all of the VBScript administration 
scripts, and an All PowerShell Scripts folder that contains a 
single .zip file of all of the Windows PowerShell scripts.

Open the folders as needed and copy the files to your hard drive.

------------------
Additional Reading
------------------
In the Additional_Reading folder are a selection of Microsoft Press 
mini-book PDFs plus sample chapters from selected Microsoft Press 
titles. Also included is the complete eBook version of Introducing 
Windows Server 2008 from Microsoft Press. 

-----------------
Tools for Reading
-----------------
Use this set of links to download Adobe Reader for reading PDF
files, the .docx compatibility pack for reading .docx files (Word 2007), 
and the Word viewer for reading Word 2003 and earlier .doc files.

To uninstall the tools for reading, make the appropriate selection
from Add Or Remove Programs in Control Panel.

--------------------
Additional Resources
--------------------
Use this set of links to view the author web sites, and to access 
additional Windows Vista resources.
